moves.11. f3 Ne7: PxPh4 was still available, but Bd7 would also be nice.
moves.17. Kxf2 O-O 18. c4 Bc6 19. d5 Bb7 20. Q: Ok, you are ahead 3 points.  Watch out for QxPh7#.  Like maybe g6.
moves.20... Nd7: Oh no!  White can now play QxPh7#.  (That hash mark "#" means "game over").
moves.21. b3: Nf6 won't do it, white could push a pawn.  You must move g6 or h6, or you risk losing.
moves.21... Nc5: You could have gotten away with f5 too (momentarily), but white is unlikely to pass up checkmate much longer.
